alert.note: Alert for Northern Coos; Southern Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 04 at 11:42AM EST until March 04 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT SNOWSTORM CONTINUES... .Heavy snow is beginning to wind down as center of low pressure moves east into the northwest Atlantic. The heaviest snowfall will continue across much of western Maine and Seacoast New Hampshire through early afternoon before tapering off. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations up to two inches for a storm total of 5 to 11 inches. * WHERE...Portions of south central and western Maine. Portions of northern New Hampshire. * WHEN...Until 7 PM EST this evening. * IMPACTS...A snowstorm will bring plowable snow to the region with a period of moderate travel impacts expected. Periods of moderate snow and low visibility will be the biggest hazards.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
